name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet:
If you don’t identify with the gender that you were assigned at birth, you’re considered transgender. 

This also typically does includes non-binary people, as people aren’t typically assigned nonbinary at birth. (Though some nonbinary people do not identify as trans.)

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet: If you identify with the gender you are assigned at birth, you are considered cisgender, because the prefixed CIS means same. You are the same gender you were assigned at birth.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet: Gender is a social construct and a socially identity. Someone’s gender is determined by how they feel. An individual can feel more like a man, or more like a woman, they can also feel like both, or neither, or something in between.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet: Then it was time for the real work to begin: the removal of the mask, and the beginning of asking myself what I really wanted, and if my motivations were my own, or for the benefit of other people.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet: I came to a place where I could no longer maintain the complex social mask that had protected me for most of my life, and when it all fell apart, I found myself in a place of crisis and was diagnosed Autistic at 29.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet:
Being invisible was safer and preferable to standing out, so I did my best to be invisible, and it almost killed me.

Eventually, I got to a point where I couldn’t do it anymore.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet:
I hid for safety, to blend in, not make waves, to avoid bullying and harassment, though bullies still managed to find me. 

That’s what happens when you grow up in a violent, hostile place, where you don’t feel you’re safe, and you are forced into the peripheries of society.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet: As someone who knows how painful living in multiple types of closets can be, I know that hiding for physical and emotional safety, can take an emotional toll.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet: Over the years I learned to compensate for, or mask, my struggles and differences, but not all NeuroDivergent People can hide the ways in which they are different.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet:
We do it to keep ourselves safe, because the world around us can be very hostile. 

It’s not intended to be manipulative or deceptive. 

If we are masking around you, it often is because we don’t feel safe enough to drop our guard down, and be our most authentic selves.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet: Something it is important that we understand, whenever we’re talking about NeuroDivergent masking and camouflaging is that, this camouflaging is something that NeuroDivergent People do as a self-defense mechanism.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet: NeuroDivergent masking, or camouflaging, is defined as when a NeuroDivergent Person consciously, or subconsciously, masks or hides Divergent traits, in order to blend in or appear NeuroTypical.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet: In my thirties, I had to teach myself to ask for help, because I learned to mask those weakness, instead of speaking up for my needs.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet:
It is a human need to be accepted as we are, the whole person strengths, weaknesses, and this includes all of our identities.

Hiding parts of who I am was preventing me from moving forward in life, and getting help when I needed it.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet: That is that I can only be truly happy and successful, if I am able to be my most authentic self, permitted to exist, and comfortable in my own skin, as I’m actually quite sure is the case for every single person reading these words.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet: Since discovering my NeuroDivergence, over five years ago now, I’ve learned something that sounds simple in hindsight. I wish I wish I could have known all along…

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet: We may break from masking and hiding our differences, struggles, and even our joys and our passions, in order to avoid the critical and disapproving gaze of NeuroTypical people around us.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet: Many of us are damaged from the pressure, and the shame, that society puts on those of us whose minds work differently.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet: Over and over again, we are asked to try harder to flex ourselves into these broken and outdated systems, until we break… instead of flexing the systems, so that we may evolve and find solutions that work well for everyone.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet: We are told that are ways of doing things: thinking, experiencing the world are wrong, and we’re broken NeuroTypical people, who should try harder to fit ourselves into NeuroTypical systems, and NeuroTypical expectations, and NeuroTypical lifestyles, that often do not suit us.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet:
Historically NeuroDivergent People have not had much opportunity to give input when developing systems in society. 

Our needs, aren’t taken into consideration, because we are often pathologized.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet: Luckily the knowledge that I have gained has changed my life, and helped me to get myself back on track, finally, allowing me to figure out how to live authentically, as a NeuroDivergent Person, and live a more appropriate, NeuroDivergent lifestyle.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet: Not knowing this critical piece of information about myself, had a huge impact on me, and I was not in a good place when I found out I was Autistic.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈

tweet: I didn’t know I was Autistic for the first part of my life because NeuroDivergence is an invisible form of diversity, that can be easily overlooked by the untrained eye.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet:
Now I automatically assume that people couldn’t possibly like me, are pretending to be interested in what I have to say, and are only nice to me out of obligation or to get something from me. 

Social anxiety really is a funny thing… and by funny I mean it’s a total mind f*ck.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet:
As I started to realize how many signals I was missing, a shift happened and I became acutely aware of the many people who were “just being nice” through out my life.
Cowards, afraid of sharing what would have been a truer kindness with me (the truth, they didn’t really like me).

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet:
Little me was naive and sweet, a child who would walk up to strangers, yammering on endlessly about dogs or one of my other interests.

I was unable to pick up on the subtle hints of disinterest and annoyance, oblivious to the people mentality checking out as I spoke at them.

tweet: People often see “aggressive behavior” & focus on extinguishing it, without taking into consideration why the aggression has become the go to defense mechanism or what fear, pain, & trauma created that response.

tweet:
Dogs react to fear & trauma, a lot like people do. When they are afraid they may fight, freeze, fawn or flee. 

When a dog is lashing out & acting aggressively, that reaction typically originated from a place of fear & insecurity.

tweet:
The method sometimes known as “no free rides” (where you find out what the dogs loves & withhold it until you see “desirable behaviors”) is especially cruel. 

Why should we make dogs “work for everything”? What gives us the right to break dogs & force them to bend to our will?

tweet:
Compliance based “training” methods destroy a dog, & put increasing strain on the relationship between dog & custodian. 

These methods destroy trust. They also inhibit an animal’s ability to think for themselves, & create unhealthy levels of codependency between dog & caregiver.

tweet:
Puppies, quite naturally, are eager to communicate with humans. However, people often ignore & “extinguish” their attempts at communication, through “training” & compliance. 

By focusing on making dogs less of an intrusion on humans, people lose sight of what’s best for the dog.

Phases that shut me down & trigger my avoidance include: “Do this!” “Don’t do this” “you must” “you should” 

Alternatively, “Have you considered” or “Did you know” “I would like to share something with you” work much better.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet:
Reasonable requests, however, are always considered. 

It all depends on how you ask me… 

ASK don’t demand. 

I don’t take orders. In fact, they shut me down & compel me to do the opposite of what’s been demanded of me.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈

tweet:
I am a demand avoidant person. 

Now that I understand this fact about myself, I do not allow people in my life to come to me with demands or ultimatums. 

If people violate this boundary, I cut them off or block them (if it’s social media). 

Demand = instant NO!

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet:

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet:
Learning I’m Autistic has opened my mind… & set me free from weights I didn’t even know were upon me, because struggling beneath them was my normal. 

I can now accommodate myself, & ask others to help meet me where I need them to, instead of ignoring my own need, & struggling.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet:
I understand my own communication needs, & have been able to learn more about how others communicate too. 

How communication, like all things in humanity, is a spectrum… & that communication is a two way street, so no all miscommunications are my fault.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet:
For example, not knowing how to avoid sensory overload, migraines, vertigo, & seizures from exposure to my sensory triggers (like fluorescent lights). 😵‍💫

Also understanding that me having the ability to work alone, on my own schedule, helps me prevent meltdowns.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet:
I was diagnosed Autistic at 29.

I did not understand the ways in which my mind works for almost the first 30 years of my life.

I didn’t understand my needs or how to speak up for them. 

Not knowing had great consequences on my mental & physical health.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet: Once in burnout, it becomes like a helpless spiral, stuck in a spin. I have to climb back up, recover, & heal, then adjust and find a way to prevent another burnout from happening, knowing that I am buying time, because burnouts have always been my normal, surviving not thriving.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet:
My ability to thrive depends heavily on how well supported I am in any given environment.

If my needs are not met, I will break down & burnout in spectacular fashion, falling apart & regressing, as my hard earned skills slip away from me 1 by 1. 
I stop eating, living, enjoying.

tweet:
A lot of my family history on one grandparent’s side (much of it lost) was kept orally, through story telling. 

The enemy to oral history is shame… 

When people become ashamed they stop telling their stories & sharing them.

We may never recover those stories now.

description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet: Just posted a photo @ Texas https://t.co/GQaRW197cH

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet: Now that I’m thriving… & I’ve moved out of survival mode, some people assume that I have never struggled, ignoring all the hard work that’s been done in my life to get me to where I am today. I’ve had to work extra hard to get where I am now, like many late discovered Autistics.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet:
People assume that, since I was diagnosed Autistic late in life, it means I didn’t struggle before learning that I was Autistic. 

This is definitely not not the case. Before learning the truth, I was in survival mode, surviving not thriving, because just surviving was my normal.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet:
I didn’t get good grades. 

I’ve often struggled to pay the bills. 

I have never been able to keep up with housework & chores. 

I’ve spent most of my life, since childhood, chronically ill (migraines, IBS, seizures) from repeated burnouts, thanks to NeuroTypical expectations.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet:
I was expected to do these thing with ease and without help. 

I kept pushing myself harder than most, burning myself out & breaking myself, just to accomplish the same results people around me seemed to accomplish with little to no effort - a constant reminder I wasn’t enough.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet:
I was expected to make good grades. 

I was expected to support myself from a younger age than most & to pay my own bills & maintain employment, & keep a roof over my head. 

I was expected to keep up with chores & housework. 

I was expected to never burn out.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet:
Growing up not knowing that I was Autistic meant that for most of my life I was held to nonAutistic standards (by myself & the world around me). 

I was expected to do the things everyone else was capable of, & when I couldn’t was punished & shamed for it.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈

tweet:
NeuroDiversity - Judy Singer's concept RE: diversity in ALL human brains (including NeuroTypicals)

NeuroDivergent - people whose brains "diverge" from what's considered typical by society. 

NeuroDiverse - used when talking about the diversity in all brains - includes NT's

description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet:
If we have multiple disabilities, on top of being Autistic, of course we will struggle more. 

However, lumping our additional disabilities into the autism label means they’re written of as part of the Autism & ignored, so we don’t get the help we need.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet:
This doesn’t mean they are “more autistic” than Autistics who don’t struggle.

Being Autistic means we are likely to have additional disabilities (seizures, motor control issues, intellectual/processing differences).

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet:
There’s no such thing as “severe autism”.

There are Autistic people who have additional disabilities (Autism+), on top of being Autistic, who may struggle more with independent living tasks/NT expectations.

#ActuallyAutistic

For so much of my life I was overly worried about making other people comfortable, so much so that I often put my own comfort below the comfort of others. 

Now I feel if people are uncomfortable around me, I rather they just go away.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet: I was doing my best to survive a system that wasn't designed with my needs in mind. I WAS PUNISHED when I struggled with what was stacked against me and showed signs of pain because my needs weren't being met.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet: My needs weren't being met, and as a child, I could not verbally express what those needs were. The outcome of not meeting those needs was inconvenient for others, and my struggles labeled undesirable "behaviors."

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet: Often when young people "act up," their behavior means something. The answer in these situations is not to focus on the "behaviors" you see, but to look deeper, assume good intentions, and seek the needs that influenced those outward expressions.

I’m not a phonetic reader. Never have been or will be. I see the words as individual little pictures. I read fast, & my brain naturally omits typos. 

This makes me a lousy proof reader, though I can quickly digest text (especially on a screen with warm tint). #ActuallyAutistic

tweet:
Professional relationships have rulers, scripts, & structure… clear boundaries, & are predictable, because I report to myself & managed my own calendar.

There are contracts & agreements in business… making these relationships safer for me than those that are social in nature.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet:
I avoid doing things I’m bad at. 

So I avoid socializing with new people whenever possible, because I find navigating new relationships very  difficult.

I stick tho the same small handful of friends I’ve had for most of my adult life, keeping other relationships professional.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet: As the NeuroDivergent mask began to fall, so did the mask I had built around my gender, eventually leading me to coming out nonbinary during the summer of 2020.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet: Then it was time for the real work to begin – the removal of the mask, and the beginning of asking myself what I really wanted and if my motivations were my own, or for the benefit of other people.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet: Eventually, I got to a point where I couldn’t do it anymore. I came to a place where I could no longer maintain the complex social mask that had protected me for most of my life, and when it all fell apart, and I found myself in a place of crisis, I was diagnosed Autistic.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet:
That’s what happens when you grow up in a violent and hostile place, when you feel you don’t belong and are forced to the peripheries of society. 

Being invisible was safer than standing out, so I did my best to be invisible – and it almost killed me.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet: I hid for safety, to blend in, and not make waves. I hid to avoid being the target of bulling and harassment – though bullies still seemed to find me.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet:
I held myself to NeuroTypical standards, forcing myself to fit into their boxs, at the expense of my own mental and physical health. 

I held myself to cis, heteronormative standards, feeling like I was living a lie, pretending to be someone I wasn’t for the comfort of others.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet: I also knew around that same time that I wasn’t like the other kids, but not knowing I was NeuroDivergent, also meant not having the language to describe that experience – & falsely believing that I was a lazy, inferior, NeuroTypical child – holding myself to those standards.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet: I knew at the age of four or five that I wasn’t a girl, but could not articulate why I knew what I knew, and the world told me I was a girl and had to get used to that somehow.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet: Nobody can see the shifting and swirling inside, unless I choose to express it outwardly, but I can feel the pulling and the flexing that has been happening for most of my life.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet:
I am Autistic & I am also trans. I do not identify as male or female. 

I am someone who floats in the in-between. My gender is less clearly defined, & neat. It is fluid, & can flux & wave. 

I am like the tides, pulled by the moon, as my gender flows back and forth inside me.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet: Like with many things, being Autistic means that I don’t fit into the box. I make my own box. I am the square peg that can’t be put through the round hole without damaging the peg and my experience of gender is no different.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet: Learning to live my best and most authentic life (in relation to all of my identities) has been instrumental in me getting my mental health back on track. That is something I wish for others like me all over the world.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet: Many of us are damaged from the pressure and shame society puts on those who’s minds work differently, masking, hiding our differences, struggles, and even our joys and passions, in order to avoid the critical and disapproving gaze of the NeuroTypical people around us.

I don’t train our dogs. I only focus on teaching them words, communication, & language. 

The more language the dogs learn, the “better their behavior” is naturally. 

As they are able to tell me what they need (& get their needs met), they become much happier & less frustrated.

tweet: @dukejamdogmom It hurts even more when people who know you are Autistic don’t give you grace… like being tricked into having a false sense of safety.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet:
The problem is that almost everyone expects me to have an ability to read people’s minds… an ability I simply don’t have.

I know engaging means I am likely to be punished for my inability to preform the desired behavior as expected. 

Why do I even bother? 

Because I’m lonely.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet:
In order to be in a relationship (business, friends, professional) I NEED people who don’t expect me to “read between the lines” “read expressions” or “read the room” - frequently I can’t do these things, no matter how hard I try.
#ActuallyAutistic

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet:
Because this has happened to me over and over again, it has made me hesitant to engage with others or start relationships.

My fear of getting it wrong holds me back from even trying.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet:
This trauma leaks into EVERY SINGLE relationship & situation that I enter. 

It is so ingrained into my being that I can no longer separate myself from it.

This society, and the pain of being an outsider, has left me broken, and with an inability to trust my own judgment.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet: Over and over again, I am told my feelings are “too much”, my reaction is “out of proportion”, and I am “complaining about nothing” - the message is that my feelings don’t matter… my perspective is invalid…& I am not important enough to have an opinion.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet: I annoy people… and people expect me to know when I’m being annoying, but, in reality, I often have no idea I am “being annoying” … until the person I’m annoying lashes out at me.

tweet: “You should have known” may be printed on my headstone one day. #ActuallyAutistic

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet:
Over & over again, I am expected to “read the room” (whatever that means) … if I fail to read it correctly I am punished in on of many ways:

I may be punished with ridicule, laughter, or multiple sets or rolling eyes. 

I may also be punished with physical violence on occasion.

tweet: My biggest pain as an #ActuallyAutistic person is the pain… the pain of NeuroTypical expectations that are placed upon me. The pain of being humiliated when I can’t read people’s minds, or make bad predictions based upon facial expressions that mean nothing to me.

tweet:
#ActuallyAutistic #AskingAutistics - what are your favorite sensory protection items? 

I use sunglasses, hats, & noise canceling headphones the most.

Because Autistic sensory profiles can very greatly from person to person, what works for one person may not work for the next.

tweet:
For me, personally, the worst thing about my Autistic experience is that I struggle to decode the intentions of people around me. 

If people have bad intentions I don’t always notice it. 

This makes me vulnerable & has gotten me into some troublesome situations in the past.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet:
What I will not allow is for another person to ever again force me to hide my NeuroDivergence, my joy, struggles, or pain. 

I won’t shrink, because for many years I made myself small because I didn’t believe I was worth a breath on this earth & now I know better.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈

tweet: I spent enough of my life trying to make myself palatable to other people, that doing so almost broke me. Learning I was Autistic at 29 set me free. I will not hide any longer, simply because my authenticity makes some people uncomfortable. Those people are welcome to walk away.

tweet:
#ActuallyAutistic #AskingAutistics - where do you feel most of the misunderstandings you have with other people come from? 

Tone? 
Nuance? 
Unspoken expectations? 
People intentionally twisting what you say, implying meaning that’s just not there? 
All of the above?

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet:
Being constantly told to hide yourself… hiding your gender, or sexuality, in closets, or being made to be ashamed of the way you think, or how your body moves when relaxed.

It creates an anxiety inside you, feeling the need to stay hidden… concealing your true self.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet: Being told you are broken, a burden, or a lesser person than the people around you is the kind of pain that erodes your confidence, and the fabric of your being… leaving you questioning and second guessing every choice you make and everything you do.

tweet:
With this policy  @Twitter is only protecting their liability by refusing to allow these conversations on its platform - protecting itself by putting the most vulnerable people on the platform at increasing risk. 

This is dangerous negligence by Twitter.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet:
How would this help someone who’s struggling? Taking them off of social media??? 

It doesn’t. It isolates them more. 

If they’re really on edge and so desperate for help they reach out on social media, & then have their account locked/deleted it may push them over the edge.

description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet:
I am a person who’s always been driven by the question “Why?” I see something & need to understand what caused a situation. 

I can't act without understanding the "whys", as I use them to build my plan of how to act & engage moving forward. 

#AskingAutistics - anyone relate?

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet:
It is the same pain of my ancestors, forced into Catholicism… forced into hiding …. assimilation for survival. 

Generations later, I am fighting back:

Rebelling against a culture of assimilation over individuality.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet: Growing up Queer, in the Bible Belt, & not knowing that I was NeuroDivergent, meant I felt the pain & shame of being forced to be something I wasn’t from many (sometimes well meaning) onlookers, & eventually the pressure from all angles to conform became suffocating.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet:
This was a few weeks after my autism diagnosis, over 5 years ago now.

The complex mask I had built, trying desperately to fit in was cracking, & I could no longer be who my employer needed me to be. 

Being constantly compared & held to NeuroTypical standards had broken me.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet:
Years living in closets of various types (NeuroDivergent closet/Queer closet) taught me a lot about self acceptance, pride, & identity. 

I learned that not being true to myself was slowly draining my mental health, I remember spiraling downward do a low point.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet: Unfortunately, through out my life there have always been people (often in positions of care/power/authority) who tried to push me to hide parts of myself from the word, the parts of me they thought other people would reject.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet: When parents ask my advice, one thing I can say with confidence is that all kids (NeuroDivergent/NeuroTypical/Queer/cis/straight) need to know that who they are is nothing to be ashamed of. That they are not broken people, & they are is naturally worthy of love & respect.

tweet:
I have to constantly explain that I have a right to exist, and I’m not a broken human. 

It Is exhausting.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet:
Most people don’t have to constantly explain their existence to others, unless you’re part of a minority group. 

Being Autistic, being trans, in addition, being multiply marginalized, it’s like:

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet: When people only want to talk about the worst parts being Autistic, they often will list off co-occurring health conditions, that some Autistic People have, as part of the gloom and doom against Autistic People saying, “look, autistic people are so horrible”

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet: We need doctors, professionals, and people to understand that NeuroDivergent brains really are different and that we are not broken NeuroTypicals, so that we can look at us as complete, whole, people, and stop dismissing us when we have legitimate, additional, health issues.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet: Even medications, that are intended for NeuroTypical brains, may not work the same with NeuroDivergent brains.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet: Autistic and NeuroDivergent health is different than NeuroTypical health.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet: There are many types of intelligence, but often these types of standardized measures are used against Autistic and NeuroDivergent People.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet: I HATE the way they describe all of these things, because I believe that intelligence comes in many forms, and standardized IQ tests, and standardized measures of intelligence are very limited, and tend to be biased, and tend to only measure one particular type of intelligence.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet: Something else that can happen with Autistic People, just like it can with non-autistic people is we can be “intellectually gifted”, or we may be “intellectually disabled”, or we may be “intellectually average” – air quotes.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet:
These are just things that CAN happen with Autistic People, and are more likely to happen with Autistic People.

Some autistic people may not have the particular set of issues that I am dealing with.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet: So it takes me longer to learn things that require a lot of motor control, and I have really bad handwriting.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet:
I am Autistic, and I also have auditory processing issues, which means I can sometimes miss hear words, and I don’t hear words accurately word for word. 

I also have sensory issues, and I can be a bit clumsy because being Autistic can also impact our fine motor control.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet: If Autistic People are dismissed, it can lead the person to not getting help, because someone just says, “oh, Autistic People just have these problems. That’s part of being Autistic” instead of treating the additional issues that Autistic People can have going on.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet: For example, my social anxiety, that is something I have in addition to being Autistic, that can be helped with attention to the problem or made worse by ignoring the issues anxiety causes.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet: Too often I see an issue where people will dismiss an Autistic Person, who is showing signs of being in distress, or showing signs of having something else going on, in addition to being Autistic, that they could potentially need help with, or get help with.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet: They are not just NeuroTypical many NeuroTypical people also have additional things going on in their life, and may have additional health conditions or disabilities in addition to being NeuroTypical.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet: There’s just many things that Autistic People can have going on in addition to being Autistic. I am also hyperlexic, in addition to being Autistic. I am not just Autistic. I am Autistic and I have more going on in my life, which is also the case with NeuroTypical People.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet:
If I have a bunch of meetings in the morning, I will be exhausted by the second half of the day, & have no creativity left in my brain.

Different people may find their energy to peak in different times of the day.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet:
I work best in the morning. 

Some people may be better starting a bit later in the day, or the afternoon. 

Other people may even be better at working late at night.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet:
Because other people can wear me out, I do like to get quiet, focused work, done in the morning, when I’m feeling fresh and inspired.

Other exhaust me, & will often drain the creativity right out of me.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet: If you assign tasks to people, and they are poorly suited for those tasks, it is going to cost them more mental energy, and efficiency, in doing those tasks, regardless of NeuroType.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet: Tasks I am poorly suited for can take me longer, so it is really important when matching people with tasks in workplaces, or if you are looking for your own career, to do tasks that you’re well-suited for, or to assign tasks to people who are well-suited to complete those tasks.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet:
If I am left to manage myself, I can often complete a task I am well-suited for more quickly than my NeuroTypical peers, depending on the task. 

Depending on the task is an important part of that. I do have to work around my brain, and block off work in chunks.

tweet:
I love creating “text walls” but my time with you all over the past 5+ years has taught me that text walls, with lots of complex details, are not accessible to some people.

I’ve learned that #simplicity & summarizing is part of #accessibility.

#ActuallyAutistic #NeuroDiversity

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet: There are also levels of sensory overload - steps, in the process to getting overloaded, where I start to feel overloaded, as the lights get loud and everything gets overwhelming, before a more intense, complete, overload, where I may shut down, cry, or run out of a room.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet: Learning about sensory overload, it’s important to understand that each individual human being has their own unique sensory profile, & individual settings for sight, smell, touch, taste, how well you feel your sense of balance, & where your body is in space, depth perception.

tweet: #AskingAutistics - Anyone else, who experiences this, what are some things that, for you, can make sensory overload, and sensory overwhelm, more likely to occur?

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet:
These things happening tend to make my sensory overload more likely, or make me more prone to having sensory overload.

#ActuallyAutistic #Autism

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet:
It can be the perfect storm if that person is feeling low energy that day, or they’ve already got a lot on their plate. 

Maybe they’re already really stressed out about some personal thing or some change that’s happening in their life, or they’ve not slept well all week.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet:
The ability to tolerate sensations can very, depending on a variety of factors.

One of those factors being how well rested, or how well off that individual NeuroDivergent Person is doing, on that particular day.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet: The first thing I would love for people to understand about sensory processing and sensory overload is that a NeuroDivergent Person, with sensory processing difference’s ability to tolerate certain stimuli can vary, from week to week, month to month, even day to day.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet: If I use headphones, or sunglasses, or some other sensory protective gear, or tool, I can prevent myself from being overwhelmed by the world, that doesn’t take my needs into consideration.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet: Before I found out I was Autistic, I thought a lot of this was anxiety and panic attacks, but then I realized there was actually environmental triggers, causing this reaction inside me.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet: Some of my common triggers for sensory overload would be bright, fluorescent, lighting, certain smells, and certain sounds just really get to me.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet:
What is sensory overload?

Well, for me, that is when some kind of sensory input becomes so overwhelming to me that I either shut down, meltdown, or run away from it; because I am basically sent into almost a panic or, just this need to stop, or get away from and escape it.

tweet:
My medical phobia is so bad that I MIGHT consider going to the doctor if I knew for a fact I would die otherwise… maybe. 

This isn’t a cry for help. This isn’t me looking for advice. This is me sharing how fucked up our medical system is here in America.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet:
Now I’m worried about something new… but because my medical phobia/aversion is so bad…. I probably will continue to ignore my concerns.

Doctors need to do better. I didn’t know phobias could kill you, but this one s dangerous.

#ActuallyAutistic #MedicalTrauma #MedicalPhobia

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet:
Years ago, I was referred to get some testing done regarding some potentially lifelong disabilities, & to rule out/test for a few possibly life threatening conditions. 

I never went.

Why? 

Medical trauma
Not wanting to know
Fear of having a “preexisting condition on my record”

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet:
I now know that I can learn lots of things, if I’m passionate about them, and I study them, in my own way, on my own pace.

I am not the failure. The public education system in Texas failed me. Education systems, all over the world, fail many Autistic and NeuroDivergent students.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet:
I left school believing I was a broken person. 

I left school thinking I was incapable of learning. 

I left school with very low self-esteem, and I have been recovering from school ever since.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet:
When I went to to the teacher for help, because the other kids were picking on me, and 
bullying me, and calling me names. 

The teacher told me that, maybe if I stopped acting so weird, and would act normal, the other kids wouldn’t bully and pick on me so much.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet:
Some of my worst bullies in school, we’re actually the teachers, and I’m not just talking about tying my legs to the chair and not letting me pee.

Both really crappy situations no child should endure.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet: I was holding my pee at school for unhealthy amounts of time, because I was afraid of being scolded by the teacher for asking to go to the bathroom.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet: I still try to break the habit of not going to the bathroom until the very last minute, and feeling like having the need to go to the bathroom is a problem, because school taught me that I shouldn’t have to go to the bathroom very much, and I should repress the need to pee.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet: Being a child who has stomach issues, who was punished and scolded for needing to go to the bathroom, and extra bathroom breaks, was an extremely traumatic experience.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet: At home if I needed to go to the bathroom, I just went to the bathroom. I didn’t need to ask permission, or excuse myself, to get my basic human needs met, but in school, bathroom breaks were scheduled and limited.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet: In addition, I was stripped of a lot of autonomy when I entered school. We’re trying to teach Autistic and NeuroDivergent kids to have autonomy, to be able to speak up for their needs, and get their own needs met, but this was not the message I received.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet:
A lot of teachers, when I was growing up, would expect me to look at them, so that they knew I was listening.

To be looking at them was me pretending to listen, while not actually listening – counterproductive to my learning.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet:
My NeurodDivergent attention does not look like NeuroTypical attention. I don’t need to look at you to think or focus. 

In fact, not looking at you, makes it a lot easier for me to think and process information.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet: I discovered that I could draw, or doodle, or read ahead, or do other things, to keep myself engaged, but often drawing, or doodling, or reading ahead, was taken by the teacher in authority, as a sign of being disrespectful, or not paying attention.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet: Sometimes it would literally put me to sleep, to try and be expected to listen to a teacher, talk at the front of the room. I would just get so exhausted, because of my audio processing difficulties.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet: I often would do really well, set to study and read something on my own, assuming it was something that could catch my interest, but listening to a teacher, speak at the front of the room wasn’t ideal for me.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet:
When I get overwhelmed, it can sound like the teacher from Charlie Brown is talking to me. “Wa wa wa wa wa wa.”

I know you’re talking because your lips are moving, but I don’t understand the words you say.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet:
I am someone who has audio processing difficulties. This made school difficult for me.

Being in a room full of noisy busy children, trying to listen to a teacher speak at the front of the room, is very difficult if you are unable to hear words, word for word.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet: Because I was hyperlexic, it was assumed that I was not applying myself, and that I was being lazy, and I could do these things, if I would just apply myself.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet: History, the way history is taught here in Texas, it was horrible. I couldn’t, I couldn’t make myself care, but you’re expected to be able to force your brain to focus on things and I wasn’t able to.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet: I was very good at the subjects I was good at: English, reading, art, certain types of mathematics, but not all math, but I was also very, very bad at the subjects that I wasn’t good at.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet:
It’s as if my memory does not absorb information that my brain has decided is uninteresting or irrelevant. 

I am either an expert at something, or I am complete and utter garbage at it. I’m an all or nothing person. 

There is no in-between with me.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet:
However, I am someone who struggles to pay attention to things that do not catch my attention. 

If a topic does not interest me, despite the fact that I can read far above grade level, when reading about things I don't care about, I can read over & over but nothing sinks in.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet: Because my reading level was so advanced, adults and teachers around me expected me to be way more mature than I actually was, and expected me to do great in every class and every subject.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet:
All of these things are a cocktail, that impact my life.

Part of my cocktail in school, that was causing me a lot of trouble, is being hyperlexic, having an advanced reading level, & advanced vocabulary (reading at a college level in second grade).

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet:
When I entered school, I was made aware that I am "an annoyance and inconvenience for the people around me" - Which was an instantly traumatizing experience.

I am Autistic, ADHD, & also hyperlexic. I now also have social anxiety -  from years of rejections, & being told off.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet: Before I came to school, none of this was an issue. I could lay alone in my room on the floor, reading and studying by myself in a room, singing and talking to myself, verbally stimming, while drawing circles on the floor with my feet in the carpet, & nobody cared - until school.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet:
The way I learn was a problem for teachers. I am not someone who sits completely still, ever.

I learned from an early age when I entered school, that the way my body moves is "inappropriate" - & have been trying to unlearn this in adulthood.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet: School is the one thing that, though I don’t dream very often, if I have some sort of reoccurring nightmare, it is likely to be about school; and unfortunately, a lot of Autistic and NeuroDivergent people share these similar sentiments about education.

tweet:
This past year I trained multiple corporate clients & I also got to do consulting on some #Autism police training earlier this year. That was extremely rewarding.

Some of the coolest things that have happened in the past year are things most people will never hear about.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet: 5 years ago, if you told me I would be teaching Occupational Therapists about Autism, & teachers how to teach NeuroDivergent students… I would not have believed you… but I’ve done both this past year and will be doing a LOT more in 2022. #ActuallyAutistic

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet:
The “professionals” are finally listening to, & platforming, #ActuallyAutistic & #Neurodivergent voices, getting us to do their trainings & training the “professionals” about our life experiences. 

Wish I could share more, but I can’t just now. 💜

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈

tweet:
When they tell you that your light is too bright, turn it up, not down. 

Don’t give into the pressure from bullies and tormentors to hide your true self from the word. 

Spread your wings. Don’t make yourself small to fit into spaces that aren’t meant for you.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet:
Don’t entertain people who are trying to bring you down, to elevate themselves.

Some people are so insecure that anyone else’s success feels like a threat to them. 

They will try to dim your light, because it shines brighter than theirs does, instead of tending their own fires.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet:
Be aware of people who pick apart every little thing you do, trying to make you doubt yourself, planting seeds of self doubt into your head.

Don’t listen to people who tell you you are not good enough, because they know deep down inside they are the ones who are not good enough.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈

tweet:
There are some people in the world who will hate everything you do, just because you are you and they are them. 

Some people want a reason to hate you, and if they don’t have a real one they will make one up.

People like that are the problem… NOT you. Remember that.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
