name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet:
Every single time I let a new person into my life there is a constant nagging in the back of my mind:

“Will they hurt me?” “Will they use me?” “Will they abuse me?” “Do they really like me, or are they manipulating me like many have done before?”

#SocialAnxiety

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet: My biggest struggles come from the demands of other people…. which makes me extremely anxious because I also have social anxiety from years of misreading social situations.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet:
I’ve been called names because of my anxious reactions:

Bossy, control freak, sensitive, neurotic, complainer, extra, rude, stubborn, rebellious, difficult, lazy 

People were often quick to cast blame for my behavior, but rarely offered any help when I was struggling.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet:
I need a lot of control over my life, surroundings, & schedule, to keep myself calm & centered. 

I am lost without structure & routine. 

Being out of control makes me very anxious. 

I’m not fun to be around when I’m anxious. When I panic, I make regrettable choices.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet:
My avoidance to demands means I’m constantly avoiding other people & projects, because they may make demands of me.

It also means lots of time alone, isolated, fighting with myself to do things that I want to do, because having multiple comments at one time feels overwhelming.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet:
Demand avoidance is probably one thing that holds me back in life more than anything else, even more than my sensory issues. 

I can take noise canceling headphones, sunglasses, & sensory gear almost anywhere, but the demands of other humans (& life) are harder to escape.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet: The Strategies of ABA - What Parents Should Know Before Making a Decision » @NeuroClastic ⁦@notanautismmom⁩  https://t.co/pkJeInwAA0

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet: Uncovering our #NeuroDivergence, & understanding how our brains work has made our relationship much better, because we are now both more aware of our individual needs & triggers.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet: When neither of us knew we were #ActuallyAutistic it was harder for both of us, because neither of us understood ourselves well enough to properly communicate our needs to one another.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet:
His sensory profile is different from mine, because no two #Autistic people are the same.

Some of the sensory things that we both enjoy we engage in together, but there are things I love he cannot tolerate, & vice versa. 

We can sooth or irritate each other’s sensory needs.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet:
For example:

He loves big bright center room lights that I avoid like a vampire hiding from the son, & he is always hot, while I am always cold.

My partner also has above average spacial awareness & hand eye coordination, while my balance, & motor control is below average.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet:
No two #NeuroDivergent people are alike. Even people with the same #NeuroType can experience the world around them very differently. 

My partner & I are both #Autistic, & though we are similar in many ways, our sensory & support needs are not the same, & can even be in conflict.

description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet: @JohnBrownsBod12 So many times…

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet:
Here we sit… on opposite sides of the table…. 

So I get up and walk away into the darkness, leaving you to do what you think is right, continuing on my original path.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet:
My functioning fluctuates, I’ve said it before. 

My ability to keep up depends on the demands placed upon me & the support available to me. 

My ability to function also is dependent on my current level of mental health, & how much stress or change is happening in my life.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet:
When people put demands upon me, I am filled with a strong urge to do the opposite. 

When people tell me not to do something, it only makes me want to do it more. 

The people who want me to stop, fuel me to keep going (in defiance).

#ActuallyAutistic #ADHDer #NeuroDivergent

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet:
For many years I made myself small, because people told me I was “too much” - trying to blend in was soul & self esteem crushing. 

Because I stand out, naturally, just by being myself, I was born to stand out. 

I will not make myself small, or apologize for taking up space.

Autism & Social Hangovers – My Autistic Experience with Alcohol & Social Anxiety

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet:
Eventually, I received an Autism diagnosis.

Learning the truth about myself, confirming what I’d known since I was very young:

I wasn’t like my peers. Knowing I’m Autistic has been instrumental in my personal healing process and essential to me getting my health back on track.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet: For many years I’d been cruising along just fine in the world, keeping up with everything that was expected of me… until suddenly, in a workplace I’d been operating in for years, I found my ability to function decline.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet: Our differences in how our brains interpret and process the world and sensory information means that many Autistic people need to pay careful mind to nurture and care for their senses in ways neurotypical people do not.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet:
Autistic health is different from non-Autistic health.

There is damage that happens when you grow up not understanding the different ways in which your mind works.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet: I’m Autistic, but I didn’t know I was Autistic until I was diagnosed at the age of twenty-nine, as I was going through a period of work-related Autistic burnout. I grew up feeling alien, misunderstood, broken, and continuously being under or overestimated, but not knowing why.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet: I’ve always been different. There were hints of these differences throughout my life. For many years the truth behind my differences lay hidden from me, a secret buried deep within the inner workings of my mind… Autism.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet:
I got to take my used, 10-year-old, hand me down laptop to all my classes because many of my teachers required me to type my work. After all, my handwriting was impossible to read.

It took me years to find my voice in a word processor, but I eventually found it.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet:
My most authentic voice has never been the voice that comes out of my mouth. My most authentic voice comes from my fingertips dancing over a laptop keyboard.

It was a voice that was not fully unlocked until I got my first laptop in high school.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet: I prefer typing and reading over all other forms of communication, widely due to my auditory processing difficulties and struggles with working memory to get my thoughts out at the speed and accuracy needed for optimum face-to-face conversations without considerable scripting.

Clouded judgment/ruminating more than usual
I stop eating/drinking

Stop showering 
Can no longer keep up with chores even in our tiny space 
Feelings of worthlessness
I stop reaching out

tweet:
I am also eager to meet every animal, but extremely anxious about socializing with new people.

#ActuallyAutistic #AskingAutistics & #NeuroDivergent People anyone relate? 

#Autistic #NeuroDiversity #Animals #Dogs #Life #Autism #Friends #Anxiety #MentalHealth #SocialAnxiety

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet:
My experiences growing up have tainted my ability to trust as openly as I once could, when I was younger, before I was hurt. 

Even now, even unfamiliar animals and new species I meet are easier for me to read than humans I don’t know VERY well.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet: Even as an adult, I struggle with starting relationships with new people. I don’t know if people are being nice for the sake of niceness is if they really like me.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet: This left deep emotional wounds in me, that still “bleed” from time to time. My trust was damaged long ago - trust for others, trust for myself.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet:
Animals were always honest and true, which is more than I can say for humans.

My experience with other kids was that they often picked on me, ostracized me, or manipulated me, especially when I was younger.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet:
For many years, as a preteen and a teenager, my best friends were our family cat and  my dog, Ripley. 
When I struggled to bond with others around me (even my family and caregivers) animals always were as kind to me as I was to them - like a mirror reflection back on me.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet: When I did hang out with other kids, they were often older or younger than me, additionally, my relationships were often very superficial, because, even when I wanted to, I didn’t understand how to get close to others or let people in.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet: Growing up, I struggled in my relationships with other kids my age.

description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet: Music is so important to me that my name is, literally, Lyric. 💜 🎶

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet:
You know what’s a horrible way to find out someone was pretending to be your friend/using you? 

When a bunch of your mutuals start sending you screenshots from that person, who said they were your friend for YEARS, calling you names & discussing how much they can’t stand you.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet: Normally, when I feel the pressure building up, if I notice in time, it becomes my cue to remove myself from a situation and find a safe, solitary place. Then, at the end of a meltdown, I often feel a sense of catharsis as the pressure is released.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet: If I had to describe a meltdown, I would say it feels like a volcano building pressure until it is ready to erupt. Eventually, there is a point of no return in that volcano, when I can no longer contain the explosive release of energy and emotion and bursts out.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet:
Meltdowns are an uncontrollable reaction to intense emotions, sensory overstimulation, sudden change, or another overwhelming situation. 

Meltdowns are also physically and emotionally draining for the person experiencing the meltdown.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet:
CW: Description of meltdown 

Meltdowns are draining. Coming out of a meltdown feels a bit like coming out of a seizure. My body feels heavy, my brain is sluggish, and I’m often filled with a strong urge to nap.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet:
CW: description of meltdown 

During meltdowns, I feel a lot of overwhelming anxiety; there can be overwhelming emotions, feelings, sensory experiences, or all of the above.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet:
“Some people say that ‘having a meltdown is a symptom of being autistic,’ but I argue that meltdowns are a symptom of being overwhelmed.” 

This world is often overwhelming for NeuroDivergent people because it wasn’t designed for us.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet: It had been a while since I’d had a meltdown. I don’t have as many these days because I’ve worked hard to decrease the number of stressors (mental, physical, sensory, and emotional) in my life.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet:
CW: description of past meltdown

Throwing myself onto the bed, curled up in the fetal position balling, stuck on a horrible ride, wondering when it would end. About a half-hour later, I felt myself coming out of my tunnel as my senses and mental capacities slowly returned.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet:
CW: desecration of past meltdown 

Suddenly, I found myself past the point of no return. Tears started to well up in my eyes as I quickly hung up the phone.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet: As we neared the end of the day, I thought I knew what was coming next, but suddenly and without warning or my input, the plans changed – leaving me feeling shaken and unstable.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet: It had been a long and tiring weekend. We’d had fun, but I was running on minimal sleep and hadn’t had enough to eat, so my blood sugar was a bit low.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet:
Masking isn’t something neurodiverent people do to be deceptive or manipulative. 

We pick these costly survival skills up as we go through life, making our way through traumatic systems that unintentionally oppress us. #ActuallyAutistic

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet: This gives me an advantage because I use this skill to create advanced scripts for different situations – like YouTube Videos, Educational Presentations, or even scripts that I can take into my everyday life. #ActuallyAutistic

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet: My reading skills help advance my speaking skills because reading allows me to repeat the things I read or write out.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet: My reading skills are far above my spoken abilities, and I read very naturally, thanks to an early obsession with books and reading – starting from the age of one and a half.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet: Writing and reading have always been more accessible and more fluent for me than spoken speech. Not every Autistic person has this experience. I, however, also fall into the hyperlexic category of neurodivergence.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet: I spend a lot of time sitting in the background, listening and observing, and soaking in other people’s conversations, especially online, where I can engage in my native language – text.

description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet:
I struggle to drive, some Autistic people will never drive, and others drive as if doing so was second nature. It’s just another way all Autistics are unique.

#ActuallyAutistic #Driving #ADHDer #NeuroDivergent

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet:
Not all Autistic people have this driving difficulty. Some Autistic people are fantastic drivers. 

Like with all things, the Autistic experience of driving is vast. What’s true for one Autistic person may be entirely different for the next.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet: There have been many accidents over my driving career, especially when I was first learning to handle a car.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet:
I manage it when I need to. Driving in traffic is still strenuous, especially if I have to switch lanes or pull out into heavy or fast traffic from a stop. 

Operating a vehicle at night time will always be extremely challenging, so I avoid it as much as possible.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet: I want to be transparent with you regarding the fact that I’m still not the best driver. I’m not a great driver. I wouldn’t even call myself a good driver. I’m an acceptable driver who can get from point A to point B, very carefully, with GPS, in ideal conditions.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet: Learning to drive was one of the hardest things I’ve ever done. I had to put in many hours of practice, and even now must make extra effort to slow down and focus, but I managed to learn to do what some may have thought was impossible – learned to operate a motor vehicle safely.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet: Learning to drive wasn’t easy, but I did it.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet: In many countries, driving is a rite of passage, but some people will always struggle with driving if they drive at all.

tweet:
For years I held myself to NeuroTypical standards… never quite measuring up to the expectations of the people around me. 

I’m not NeuroTypical. I know that now.

I didn’t know it for many years, as I compared and contrasted myself to people who’s brains were not like mine.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet: When you are struggling with things that people around you find simple, it can be easily to become overly focused on how you don’t “measure up”… so much so that your weaknesses can become all you see, hiding your strengths from view.

The overload lasted for several hours… and there were signs it was creeping in early in the day. 

To recover: remove myself from the stressors/environmental or emotional, hydrate, food, caffeine (sometimes), sleep, rest, listen to music, move (sometimes). 

How do you recover?

tweet:
I’m coming back from it now… back in my sensory bubble, with my tools and the comforts of home surrounding me.

I need the predictability to be able to relate and unwind. 

I need to retreat away when people and their words become too much. 

#ActuallyAutistic #FulltimeRV

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet:
Sensory Overload is my brain telling me it’s done… that I’ve done too much and need to stop. 

Today I had more work to do… that I can’t do right now, even if I hadn’t listened to my need to stop. 

For many years, before learning I was Autistic, I would have pushed on.

tweet:
Horrible sensory overload today… light hurts. Sounds hurt. Life is fuzzy… brain ouch.

Overdid it this week and the fluorescent lights in the local tax office kicked my ass. 

Least favorite part of my NeuroDivergent experience. 

#ActuallyAutistic

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet:
An Autistic Perspective #TakeTheMaskOff – Masking, Mental Health, & Burnout

I’m a chameleon, an expert masker. I can be fun and playful, or serious and attentive. I can sit still, with proper posture, and give the impression of eye contact.

description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet:
I always seemed to like people more than they liked me… and now I’ve grown to be someone who can hardly believe anyone actually likes me. 

I’m broken from the abuse, and I don’t know how to have relationships with most other people outside of professional settings anymore.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet:
I’m not socially anxious by nature. I used to be a lot more outgoing…. But I couldn’t read people, or understand the dynamics of “fake friends” when I was younger. 

This left me easily hurt by others, who told me they were my friends but were using me or didn’t really like me.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet: Also, because I struggle to read & decode the intentions of new people, it is extra exhausting, & anxiety inducing, to expose myself to new people, who may have intentions that I don’t understand or cannot read. I am painfully aware of how vulnerable I am to manipulative people.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet:
Something that I need for people to understand is that a lot of people want to talk to me…

In addition to being Autistic, I also have social anxiety, so talking to new people is very nerve-racking for me most of the time. 

My circle is small because human contact exhausts me.

description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet:
Also… I feel as if the fact that I’m #ADHD & #Autistic means my sense of time is different from other people’s. 

I jump in when I feel there’s been a pause… but then am told I am interrupting others. I waited for what I THOUGHT was a pause.  🥺

#ActuallyAutistic

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet:
When people say taking turns in conversation is as easy as “waiting for the pause” - I have a lot of questions. 

How long of a pause is appropriate? 

I pause a lot when speaking, because I need time to think. Is this why people are always speaking over me? Because I pause?

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet:
I struggle to initiate things with other people, because I cannot often gauge their interest, if it is the appropriate moment, or if they even want me around.

I feel as if I am inconvenience or bother to other people. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHDer #NeuroDivergent #SocialAnxiety

description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet:
People can do a lot of harm, when they don't understand the pain caused by their actions personally.

EX: look at Godzilla or any other gigantic movie monster that crushes a city: 

Just an animal living its best life, oblivious the the path of destruction is leaving behind it.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet: Masking isn’t something NeuroDiverent People do to be deceptive or manipulative. We pick these costly survival skills up as we go through life, making our way through traumatic systems that unintentionally oppress us. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHDer

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet: People have a need to be accepted, that includes the whole person, strengths and weaknesses, but many of us have not been free to express ourselves and have picked up a mask as the only way we knew how to cope with the systems that weren’t designed with our needs in mind.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet: Though I’ve stopped trying to camouflage in recent years, there are many situations where standing out can cause more harm than good. It may even be dangerous depending on your surroundings/how hateful or understanding the people around you are people who are different from them.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet: In the years I was masking heavily, I lived inauthentically & could not develop meaningful relationships with people because I wasn’t showing anyone my true self. There was no way I could find my people because I was hiding much of who I was from the world. #ActuallyAutistic

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet:
My reading skills help advance my speaking skills because reading allows me to repeat the things I read or write out. 

This gives me an advantage because I use this skill to create advanced scripts for different situations – like YouTube Videos, Educational Presentations, etc..

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet: Also, because of this... I understand a lot ON PAPER... but am OFTEN CONFUSED listening to people speak out loud.... spoken speech processing & poor working memory make face to face engagements with others exhausting.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet: My reading skills are far above my spoken abilities, and I read very naturally, thanks to an early obsession with books and reading – starting from the age of one and a half.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet: Writing and reading have always been more accessible and more fluent for me than spoken speech. Not every Autistic person has this experience. I, however, also fall into the hyperlexic category of neurodivergence.

tweet: This has been one thing I said that rubbed a lot of people wrong several years ago… but I never explained myself well, or the fear  that I had, as I saw my mask falling apart… taking away my choice to hide my #Neurodivergent mind. #ActuallyAutistic

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet:
When I say #TakeTheMaskOff - it’s because I needed to remove my mask because it was making me physically (plus mentally & emotionally) ill to keep it up. 

Also, because I know some of us can’t mask/lose this ability to mask as we age… it’s a plea to society to let us unmask.

tweet:
The type of change doesn’t matter, change is change, and when changes happen, I need time and space to adjust to them, often a lot more time than non-autistic people would require. 

#ActuallyAutistic #AutisticAdult #Autism #AutisticLife

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet: The logical part of my brain wants to embrace change, but there is a part of me that has a knee-jerk reaction to the unforeseen, struggling with change, even if the change is something I want or is something that would be considered a “good change”.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet: Despite my logical understanding of the importance that change has in our lives, my Autistic brain often doesn’t handle change well, making surprises and new situations one of my biggest obstacles in life.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈

tweet: #ActuallyAutistic adults aren’t “taking away services” when we campaign against #ABA, we are campaigning for access to alternatives to ABA, but ABA, once  government funding is in place, starts taking the financial resources that fund those ABA alternatives away. #Texas

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈

tweet: But here in #Texas, & many places, #ABA is the only option… it should not be but it is, because in states & cities where ABA is funded, the funding for everything else often dries up BECAUSE ABA is so expensive it leaches money for everything else.

It’s manipulative, coercive, #Abuse.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet:
If I don’t course correct before it’s too late, I may end up in a full shutdown, or WORSE, burning out.

Repeated shutdowns, overloads, &/or meltdowns are taxing & can really drain a person, leaving them perpetually cycling from shutdown to shutdown or meltdown to meltdown.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet:
At this point, I’m often still able to “put out work” & be somewhat creative when rested.

I can survive & recharge by cutting back on some of life’s social demands. 

Other people wear me out. I spend too much time trying figure them out, & often still misinterpret many things.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet:
Sometimes I get overwhelmed & shutdown, fully or partially. 
On the way down, or in a partial shutdown, I stop reaching out & avoid looking at my notifications & social media inboxes. The idea of communicating with others becomes exhausting, as I grow avoidant of almost everyone.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet:
There is even duality in our deficits, which we are often defined by.

In medical textbooks and diagnostic manuals, also our greatest strengths, like intense passion and focus, are often laid out in a negative light.

#ActuallyAutistic

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet:
We can be calm when everyone else is panicking but be unnerved by things other people seem to ignore.  

As a child, I often seemed wise beyond my years, but at the same time, was very immature in many ways.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet:
There is a LOT of duality with autistic people.

For example, some of us have overwhelming empathy and emotions but may struggle to express them. 

We may be highly gifted in one or more areas but struggle significantly with things non-autistic people find simple.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet:
Today, more than five years since my diagnosis, I sit firmly over the line of acceptance, but getting here has been a journey. 

Nothing was instant. Arriving here meant putting in the work, getting to know myself all over again, through an Autistic lens.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet: On the opposite, you may feel empowered by this newly discovered truth. You may fall firmly into one or teeter precariously between these two extremes. I went through the stages of grief with my diagnosis. The third stage is where I started my blog, as my anger was vanishing.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet:
Autistic discovery can lead to one of two paths.

The news shakes you up, changes how you see yourself and others. Your life may fall apart as you find yourself losing people close to you.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet: I’m not “too sensitive,” “too intense,” “too emotional,” or “too excited” – I’m not “too ANYTHING.” I’m #Autistic – I’m who I’m supposed to be. #ActuallyAutistic

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet: I know this now because I finally have information about my neurology. An entire lifetime of other people dismissing my experiences and feelings is slowly being repaired.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet:
When I am upset, I find comfort in logic.

It is the glue that holds my world together. Sometimes people just need a hug. I have to remind myself that not everyone feels the same joy from the truth.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet:
To feel confident, I MUST review every scenario and outcome, bracing for the worst outcomes.
Often, I feel pressured to act before I am ready.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet: I’m a skeptic of all things unproven. My brain sees risks, and demands they need to be addressed before acting. In uncertainty, lies problems. I cannot leap without fully understanding how and where I will land.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet:
People have always accused me of being “different” or “difficult” just for the sake of being “a rebel,” but…

I’m never intentionally difficult.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈

It’s supposed to be a compliment, but it’s not because it implies there’s something wrong with being Autistic in the first place. #ActuallyAutistic

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet:
I was born Autistic. I’ve been Autistic my entire life, & I will die Autistic… but I did not know that I was #Autistic for the first 29 years of my life. 

#ActuallyAutistic #AskingAutistics & #NeuroDivergents - when did you find out you were #NeuroDivergent?

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet: Now that I have a better understanding of my neurology, & what is needed to take care of my Autistic brain, I’m determined to be better to myself & let my body do what it needs so that it can work at optimum efficiency.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet: The past few years have been filled with massive change and self-discovery, re-learning the art of stimming, allowing myself to move organically, even in public settings.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet:
I wanted to be invisible for many years. 

When my self-esteem gets low, I hide.

Not being true to myself, stuck in a state of assessing, and adapting – struggling to fit in instead of merely just exhausting in my natural state was exhausting.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet: Intentional stimming, often with music or with nature, brings me peace. I stop to put on the perfect song, rock and sing to myself wildly, take time to watch field grass blowing in the wind as my legs bounce wildly under the table as I work from home.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet: There are stims I hold in and bottle up because other people find them distracting or “obnoxious.” When I’m alone, I let them all out – finally freed from the eyes, ears, expectations, and comments of others.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet:
There are stims for every occasion, stims as part of my body language and stims done with intention.
There are stims I hide because doing them in public will bring too much attention and nasty looks.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet: Being diagnosed autistic in my late twenties uprooted me – and gave me new appreciation and curiosity for stimming.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet: I’m always in motion, rocking, bouncing, singing, humming, flapping, singing, & making sounds. I’m a stimmy human, but for almost thirty years, I had been stimming without really understanding or thinking about why.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet: Don’t misunderstand my intentions. This mask wasn’t created to impress anybody. It’s something I’ve constructed for self-preservation. When you naturally stand out, survival can depend on your ability to blend in.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet: I’m a chameleon — a fly on the wall. I settle into the background of a new environment, observing, taking things in, working to sort out the “expected behaviors” for the situation, strategically plotting out the rules for conversational engagement in my mind.

tweet: Unfortunately, I quickly discovered that talking about autism with people outside of the autistic community could be tricky.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet: When I was diagnosed autistic in my late 20’s, it was as if suddenly I’d been handed my brain’s instruction manual. That diagnosis was the tool to unlocking my success, so naturally, I wanted to share it with the world.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet: Before I was diagnosed, I’d been subconsciously hiding my autism – holding in all the parts of me that the world had deemed “unacceptable”. Stimming in private and working diligently to hide my weaknesses. I was very hard on myself, holding myself to nearly impossible standards.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet: I’ve been autistic my entire life, but I didn’t have a real understanding of what autism was until after I was diagnosed at the age of 29. Autism explained all of the pieces of me that I’d subconsciously kept hidden, my weaknesses and my failures, and my biggest strengths.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet: For much of my life, I had felt strange and alone. For the first time ever, much of what I’d thought was wired undesirable about myself began to feel acceptable and even ‘normal’. Finally, I was free.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet:
Autistic functioning fluctuates, often depending on several factors. 

How can you judge me on my best day, and claim the hard times don’t exist, especially if you’ve never been with me when I’m at my worst? #ActuallyAutistic

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet: Growing up, I was the kid with bad handwriting, picked last in sports, who couldn’t pay attention or sit still. I learned to tie my shoes late, couldn’t read the analog clock on the classroom wall, struggled to learn to ride a bicycle, and didn’t have many friends.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet: When you have a hard time with the "easy things" it’s difficult to appreciate your accomplishments because you can become overly focused on what you can’t do, that the possibilities become invisible. #ActuallyAutistic

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet: I learned I was Autistic at the age of 29, after almost thirty years of struggling in life and not knowing why I struggled with things that people around me often took for granted.

tweet: Sometimes I feel like there's been this "pause" in the conversation that everyone tells me to look for - but a which pause? I feel a pause, but was it really a break, or was it simply the other person taking a breath? Do the pauses feel longer to me than they do to everyone else?

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet:
I talk over people & interrupt. 
I don't mean to do it. 
A lot of times I don't even know I've done it until after the fact.
Sometimes I just get excited, & blurt something out.
Other times, I worry I'm going to forget what I needed to say.
When do I speak? Now? Now? NOW? #Autism

#ActuallyAutistic

tweet:
So I found my lane… 

I stick to what does not burn me out. I’ve found my flow… and people keep insisting that they have a right to change my flow to suit their own selfish needs. 

This is not okay. I’m not a thing to be manipulated.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet:
Or people wanting me, a person with a lot of educational trauma, to help with educational advocacy.
I’ve done it. I’ve sat in the ARD/IEP meetings… I’ve seen and fought against the ABA in the schools.

This is a cruel expectation. I’m not ready to relive all of that right now.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet: @AusomeCharlie I’ve done some but it brought back up my educational trauma and I’ve decided that it’s not for me - and all the begging, and guilt tripping, after I have already said NO, is not okay.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet:
So many emails…. It’s overwhelming and heavy.

I am sad I can’t help everyone, but I’m ONLY me. One #AUTISTIC person.

What’s not okayed  when they use guilt-trips if I decline:

 “But I need YOUR help”  “it’s urgent” “but I need you” “I don’t have anyone else”

It kills me.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet:
Like, I have experience in business operations and HR, so I use those skills. 

EX: I don’t have much (nor do I desire) professional experience working with kids, but sometimes people expect me to consult/help with things outside of my current ability, & are upset when I say no.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet:
Also… people OFTEN expect me to do “autism things” that I have no energy, interest, skill, or desire for - simply because I am Autistic. 

I can’t do everything. I have to set limits. I’m a human. I’m not a super hero. 

I need down time too - maybe more than most people.

Another trauma of poverty that people don’t talk about is feeling guilty for spending money on food. 

Literally feeling guilty for spending money to fuel yourself because food doesn’t last and is gone once you eat it. You get in the habit of eating less.

I applied for almost 70 jobs & got 1 callback, from a company that was completely commission biased, &  likely a scam. 
Being #OpenlyAutistic, with a large social media platform, has basically made me unemployable, one mentor gently suggested to me recently. A terrifying thought.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet:
I applied for job after job.

Before coming out Autistic Publicly, with my resume, it was easy to get callbacks for job interviews, but now, with my high social media profile, of being openly Autistic, things had shifted dramatically.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet:
The stability I had finally gained, was ripped out from under me in September of 2020, losing a job at a company that I truly love & still believe in. 

There’s been no love lost between my former boss & I & we’re still friends.

It was nobody’s fault but the economy.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet:
By luck, I found an employer that was willing to accommodate my needs to work remotely, with a flexible schedule.

It was a truly life changing experience for me, & finally empowered, I began to excel in my career… then COVID happened, & I was laid off due to no fault of my own.

tweet: For less than 5 years of my entire life/working career, while killing myself in corporate America, I managed to make  enough to be considered “above the poverty line” at the expense of my mental & physical health. I burnt out & got sick, then was diagnosed Autistic at 29.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet:
My number one desire in life for many years was stability & safety, however, eventually after years living without feeling either, I gave up hope of those things, & adapted.  

That’s life in survival mode, when having your basic needs met is never guaranteed.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet:
Living somewhere you don’t feel safe is another trauma of poverty. 

Moving into a rough neighborhood, definitely made me tougher - another survival skill that came from living in a dangerous place.

People didn’t mess with kids from my zip, we had to be tougher.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈

tweet: If I'm feeling anxious, or something or someone is too loud or overstimulating around me, I may rock in place or pace back and forth to block it and work out the energy from my discomfort.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet: Talking and singing to myself – verbal stimming is something I do a lot of without even realizing. Just yesterday, I kept meowing along to a song in the car while reading on my phone and didn't even realize I was doing it.

tweet:
I flap my hands one way when I'm excited and another way when I'm scared.

I jump up and down, clapping, and spinning when I'm really happy.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet:
Bouncing my feet under a table while working, eating, or talking,

Biting the inside of my mouth when anxious or pressed – sometimes until I bleed.

Playing with or twirling my hair, stroking pieces of fabric, or playing with zippers and ties on my clothing repetitively.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet:
It's energy regulation - energy in energy out.

Stimming is characterized as "repetitive movements" that someone may use to help themselves cope with rising energy levels in the body due to an increased emotional or sensory response.

Examples of MY stimming include:

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet:
Stimming is short for self-stimulating behaviors. – SELF-STIMULATING??? What? It's not what you may be thinking.

It's about stimulating the senses – sight, taste, touch, sound, sight, smell, the sense of bodily movements. 

Stimming is, typically, a very G-rated activity.

tweet:
You used to be normal.
I liked your old name.
You were pretty before. 
Why did you change?

I used to be miserable.
That name never suited me.
My old face felt like a lie.
I changed to feel more authentic.

tweet:
My entire life I have been told that I am too much or that my large personality takes up up too much space. 

For many years, I tried to tone it down, make myself small, so that others around me could be comfortable. 

One day, I said “screw it” & started to prioritize myself.

tweet:
When you are Autistic, but trauma has forced you to build a complex mask, people say you’re not Autistic enough. 

When you are Queer and dating a cis/straight person, people will say your not Queer enough.

You are enough even if parts of your identity are invisible to others.

Unfortunately, dog owners didn’t see their dogs as equals, like I do. 

They wanted me to help them in the creation of mindlessly compliant animals. 

I could no longer continue the old practices & left the profession.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet:
I found a better way, leaving the old ways of behaviorism behind, in favor of teaching words & signs. 

My dogs were happier. I was happier. They started to communicate their needs to me AND started to “behave” better (because they know they can get their needs met).

tweet:
It’s OK to say no to things. I didn’t know this for most of my life. 

Saying no when you don’t have the energy to deal with something is one of the most freeing things in the world that you can do.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet:
Nobody is entitled to your time. 

If people send you private messages you don’t have to respond to them. 

You’re also allowed to say no and decline engagements in conversations with people even if they really want to have them. 

It is OK to have boundaries.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet:
I’m really grateful how supportive everyone online has been of me coming out nonbinary. 

Here in Texas, life is much harder, & only 1 in 3 people around me is supportive, tries to understand, or isn’t totally dismissive & invalidating of my experience.

My heart is heavy.

tweet:
This has been bad for me in the past, when people demand me to apologize for something that I don’t understand. 

I can’t just apologize and not understand what I’m apologizing for. 

Telling me I’ve done something wrong but not explaining why or watt isn’t helpful to me. https://t.co/BFv4g6oFvI

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet:
I am not afraid to admit when I have fucked up. 

I do, however, need to understand how I have fucked up, in order to provide a sincere apology and fix my mistake. 

I can’t give a fake apology without understanding what I’ve done wrong. 

#ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDivergent

tweet:
Why is the news so bad for my mental health?

I, personally, I am someone who struggles not to focus on problems. 

I have to try really hard to focus on solutions & not think about everything that can go wrong. 

The news only talks about problems & catastrophes.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet:
Before COVID-19 started I had decided that watching the news is bad for my mental health & stopped watching. 

Now you almost have to watch the news constantly to know what’s going on with COVID-19, it’s been really bad for my mental help having news in my life again.

description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet:
CW: Physical/Mental Abuse

Every time I am manipulated by someone, my heart becomes more guarded, and closes off, in self protection.

I was a child with a big open heart, who now bares many mental scars, from years of repeated and varied forms of abuse, both physical and mental.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet:
I don’t trust others not to manipulate or hurt me. 

I don’t trust my ability to read and decode other people’s intentions and lies. 

I am afraid, because I don’t know if people are really safe.

“Does this person really want to see me succeed or are they pretending to like me?”

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet:
I have trust issues. 

I struggle to trust other people & I struggle to trust myself. 

Why do I have trust issues? 

Because I have been hurt many times by people I could not read/decode, who pretended to be kind, while having alternative motivation for their kindness.

Google may also do harm if other people copy their bad practices.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet: Now that I avoid prolonged exposure to fluorescent lights & other sensory triggers, I've not has a seizure in over 2 years, & my regular migraines are a distant memory. I also rarely suffer from sensory overload. Now that I can say "NO!" even my anxiety has gotten better.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet:
Sensory avoidance... also serves a very important function - to protect our brains from sensory overload, strain, & overwhelm. 

Since learning I was #NeuroDivergent at the age of 29, I have started actively & unapologetically avoiding experiences that overwhelm my senses.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet: I sensory seek, to balance my brain... searching for something - the perfect input, like looking for snacks in the fridge, which sensory experience will fill this sensory hunger?

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet:
Otherwise if i get out of sync, I can feel out of balance, where my body & brain fail to properly/accurately communicate with one another.  

I feel like a shaken soda, or an overcharged electronic device, it feels like I need to run off some of the energy or I may "explode".

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet:
It seems like common sense to me... engaging in sensory seeking & sensory play, helps me to feel engaged, focused, & grounded. 

In general, when I'm properly regulated, my health tends to be better too (because I sleep better, feel better, and happier.

Me: I work to escape my unpleasant feelings/emotions.

Them: You must have a lot of feelings to escape.

Me: Exactly.

Polyamorous people have had children taken away for being polyamorous. 

If one partner goes to the hospital, and they have multiple partners they are not married to, they may not be able to see the other partners on their deathbed.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈

tweet:
I’m not ashamed, but in my state and my country Polyamory is a crime, and we cannot legally marry more than one partner.

Polyamorous People do not have the legal protections that marriage would grant a couple.

Polyamorous people often cannot get on their partner’s insurance.

tweet:
It’s not just an excuse to go wild and run around with no consequences, escape commitment, & not answer to anyone, or a free pass for bad behavior. 

Those attitudes aren’t helpful. They’re very hurtful, because they stigmatize polyamorous people.

tweet: I have known that my affections work this way since I was in middle school. I also believe that being Autistic has led me to where this part of my identity on my sleeve, like the rest of my sexual orientation, without shame, despite the stigma & taboo.

tweet: Different partners tend to support each other in various ways.  This can actually be a really great way for NeuroDivergent People, or any human, to grow a better support network, so you’re not always leaning on only one person to support you all the time.

There are many reasons a trans person may choose to or be unable to transition (socially or medically). Trans people who don’t transition are still valid. 

#nonbinary #nonbinarypride #nonbinaryday #enby #internationalnonbinaryday

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet:
Do NonBinary People Transition? 

Some do. Some don’t.

The thing most people don’t understand about transition is that it’s not always linear, and that transition can look like and mean different things to different people.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet: There are also other types of dysphoria that people don’t speak about enough, in addition to physical dysphoria about people’s bodies, or voice dysphoria, there’s also social dysphoria.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet: until I started to pay attention to it, what was triggering it, and started listening to something inside me begging to realize I’ was being untrue to myself.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet: In my life there have been times where this dysphoria went away entirely, but then something in life would happen that would trigger it’s return full force just when I’d think it was gone, or getting better it would show up where I least expected it…

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet:
Do NonBinary People Get Dysphoria?

I had a lot of gender dysphoria, starring from a young age - before I even started school. I must have been 4 of 5 when it started, and things only intensified and worsened in middle school, when I hit puberty and “blossomed” one summer.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet:
Some NonBinary People don’t see themselves as trans/identify as trans, some do. 

This is because to be transgender is defined as not identifying with the gender you were assigned at birth.

It us unlikely for people to not be assigned a binary male of female gender today.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet:
Nonbinary people can use any pronouns really, so it’s a good idea to ask the person (or anyone what pronouns they use).

I like they/them, because: it means you’re not making assumptions about me, based on what you assume people with bodies like mine should be like, & act.
