description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet:
So if you ask me "how can I make a living on social media" -  I will probably tell you that "You CAN'T" because that's been my experience.

My understanding is that, unless you have millions of followers, something I don't aspire to (because it sounds overwhelming), you can't.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet:
I'm no longer working full time. I've realized it's not healthy for me to do 40 hours every week.

We've downsized, reduced spending, and slowed down repair work on our RV(home) to make up for the decrease in income/stability.

We are living on, and needing less, to live.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet:
I was working as an educator and business consultant for my former employer before getting laid off.

When I was let go, due to no fault of my own, I decided to continue the work I had been doing with my former employer on my own .

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet: Though I was laid off from my job in September 2020 due to COVID-19, and decided in April NOT to return to working for someone else full time, I STILL am working, in addition to putting out free content on my blog.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet:
In fact, for the first 4 years of my blog, not only was it not MAKING MONEY - I was SPENDING MONEY.

I used money that I was making at my various jobs to keep my blog running for the first few years.

The blog didn't break even until in year 4, after HOURS & HOURS of unpaid work.

I want to clarify something, because I get emails asking how to support yourself blogging/doing social media. 

As far as I know MOST PEOPLE CAN'T (unless you have WAY more followers than I do).

Social media is NOT how I support myself. It's more like a portfolio.

tweet:
I spent time in “special education” as it was called back then, general education, & did some advanced placement courses.

None of it was right for me, & I would often but heads with my teachers. 

I also got into trouble a lot bc of people overestimating me due to my hyperlexia.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet:
People assume that me being Autistic wasn’t noticed early in life, bc I wasn’t diagnosed until I was 29. This isn’t true at all. 

It was actually very noticeable & in first or second grade I was referred for assessment, but my guardians fearfully turned down having me tested.

tweet:
My body is in motion frequently & I have many obvious stims, such as rocking, pacing, jumping, hand flapping, & verbal stims. 

Things I used to only do when I felt safe, but I RARELY felt safe.

I learned to hide my stims for many years, despite the toll it took on me.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet:
I learned about body language in my 30s & am studying facial expressions/what they mean as an adult.

I used to think I struggled to get along with/understand most people, but since learning I’m Autistic, I’ve met many NeuroDivergent people who I get on with quite naturally.

I got stopped in my thread because, although I am coming up on two years seizure free, my epileptic dog is having more seizures than ever. Partial focal seizures, like me.

Poor Dusty had another one. I sit with him on his bed, holding him & telling him I love him till it’s over.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet:
I am obsessive…. This is great when applied to the right task but a nightmare if the obsession isn’t helpful/harmful.

My passions & hobbies are so intense, I am frequently neglecting things & people in my life to engage in them. 

My loved ones often feel unloved and ignored.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet:
I struggle to make relationships with new people and to maintain the relationships I have….

I also struggled when I was forcing myself to socialize more than I really needed/wanted because it was “expected”.

Much happier and healthier with more time on my own.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet:
People sometimes assume I don’t struggle being Autistic. 

I struggled more when I thought I was NeuroTypical and held myself to those standards for sure. 

I still struggle because my career options are extremely limited, because of the intense sensory issues I face.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet: This morning I put the toothbrush in my mouth. I quickly got to each tooth, if only in quick passing, and then after about ten seconds, was overcome with the urge to gag. At that point, I promptly aborted the toothbrushing mission and began ejecting the toothpaste from my mouth.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet: Yesterday morning was not a tremendous sensory morning. I didn't brush my teeth (but I did floss them and used mouthwash), so it was important I try today because with brushing teeth, I've found something is better than nothing.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet: If I think I can take even a few seconds of the torture, I will do my best to quickly hit every tooth in my mouth and then, if I've made it so far, the parts of my tongue I can sometimes handle.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet:
Just typing that gave me goosebumps. ICK.

Some mornings, when my sensory system is the most dysregulated, I know I will not be able to handle the minty foam drowning my senses and suffocating me until I'm dizzy and ill, so I don't torture myself.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet: If we woke up tomorrow and all the electric toothbrushes were gone, I would never brush my teeth again. I'd floss and use mouthwash, hoping to save my teeth, but I CANNOT stand the feeling of a non-electric toothbrush moving back and forth in my mouth.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet: If the toothpaste doesn't get me, the back and forth filing motion may; this is why I have an electric toothbrush. The buzzing distracts from the bristly sensation on my teeth and gums. But, unfortunately, a standard toothbrush is entirely too much.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet: The texture, taste, and foam of the toothpaste may overwhelm me instantly, causing me to wretch violently almost the instant I place it into my mouth.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet: These days, I try to take care of my teeth, making them a priority, because I know they won't last otherwise, but sometimes the sensory aspect of brushing my teeth is something I literally cannot stomach.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet: Unfortunately, not brushing my teeth frequently enough led me to lose several teeth in my mid-twenties. It was a painful and expensive lesson.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet: The executive functioning aspect of why I don't always do self-care tasks could be its own post (let me know if that interests you in the comments below), so I will not dive into that part today.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet: We could go into each of these sensory tortures in detail. Still, toothbrushing is of particular annoyance because, for many years, my avoidance of this task has caused me harm and significant expense.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet: nail/toenail files, hair brushing as a child, many types of socks, tags in clothing, injections & blood draws, circulating air on my arms if it is below 80 degrees (or if my skin is wet), and tooth brushing.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet:
I'm Autistic. A big part of that is altered sensory processing that can make sensations most people ignore entirely overwhelming. 

Some examples of overwhelming sensations (to me) include:

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet: Now many of you are likely thinking to yourselves at this point that ten seconds is not nearly enough time to brush one's mouth thoroughly, and I will admit that I would have loved to brush longer, but today ten seconds was a victory.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet:
CW: Descriptions of toothbrushing and dental stories 

Today I managed to brush my teeth, with my electric toothbrush, for about ten seconds.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet: @all_brains When I was first diagnosed Autistic and figured out that I had been having partial seizures my entire life, I had to do a very restrictive diet for two years and changed my entire life to fix things.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet: @all_brains To prevent seizures a limit how much alcohol, caffeine, and other chemicals or stimulants I take in. I make sure I get enough sleep and have a regular sleep schedule. Being tired makes seizures extremely more likely for me. I also have to limit my stress.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet: @all_brains I will curl up into a ball on the floor right where I am most of the time. I will be unable to speak until the seizure passes. I will likely be quivering all over my body. And I will be losing large chunks of time. Half hour can feel like five minutes.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet: @all_brains And a lot of times when I have a seizure the big thing for me is sensory overload comes with it and vertigo, also frequently I will throw up if I’ve had a seizure and then go take a nap regardless of how the seizure looked.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet: @all_brains The problem for me is most of my seizures are not the typical type where you are unconscious and drop on the floor shaking. Although I have had that kind before too, just less  frequently. Most of my seizures have been focal seizures or partial seizures.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet:
I often use up a lot of MENTAL energy during the week, but find myself sitting still in the work days, which doesn’t burn body energy and can leave me disregulated. 

Here I am finding balance, getting some of my excess body energy out.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet: I used to think I wasn’t someone who could sit still, but since making a point to add more physical activities to my day, I’m finding my body is becoming much more still that I thought it could be - because my need for movement has been quenched.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet: Stimming was how my body naturally reacted to having extra energy coursing through it (often from not moving enough or anxiety).

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet:
3. I still can’t moderate my voice very well regardless if I have headphones or not. 

4. I might like going to bars if I have noise canceling headphones. Wow!

5. There’s no need to get the most expensive headphones - but realize you may use them a lot if you’d like them.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet:
1. All the extra background noise was GREATLY minimized, which allowed me to be happier and relaxed.

2. I was able to hear the conversation at my table and the TV we were watching in the bar with my headphones on and noise canceling activated.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet:
Before that I had experienced noise canceling headphones in an airport - which was fantastic, but I hadn’t tried to engage with other people much with them on.

This time, using sensory protection gear in a louder social environment, I noticed the following:

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet: This past weekend, I sat my happy vaccinated Autistic ass in a bar, and had a drink and some queso with my noise canceling headphones on - no music just noise canceling.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet:
In loud bars and restaurants, this makes it hard for me to moderate my own voice.

Normally (without noise canceling headphones) understanding other people in busy environment would be impossible.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet: Even in an ideal environment (one to one with no background noise like TVs or fans) I am often unable to process what I’m hearing correctly, as my brain jumbles words on the way in, leaving me searching for content clues to find out what was said.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet:
I also struggle to process and filter sounds from words. I often mishear words or my brain skips them.

This was a problem in elementary school onward, and also continued in the workplace, and my social life.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet:
It’s all constantly draining on me (unless I block it out, listen to music, sing/talk to myself, run into nature, or do some intense physical activity/move around to distract myself).

My brain doesn’t prioritize words or filter sounds out very well.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet:
Refrigerators, ACs, and lights humming, people talking, phones ringing, plates and glasses clinking. 

The sounds pile up, drowning my brain and I cannot process everything coming at me  all at once.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet:
Before I knew I was Autistic, I would find myself in these places, feeling extremely agitated and overwhelmed but not realizing this feeling was sensory overload, and my flight/fight response being triggered. 

I hear well… 

I hear everything… 

All at the same volume….

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈

tweet: One of my biggest struggles, as an Autistic Person with Sensory Processing Differences, is often the modern indoor sensory environment (especially places where many humans tend to gather under one roof).

Now our bus, even with no running water, is a palace.

description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet:
Before learning I am Autistic, I struggled with the NeuroTypical expectations that society had for me, that were impossible for me to attain, without doing a lot of damage to myself (mental and physical).

Learning the truth set me free. #ActuallyAutistic

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet:
When I didn’t know I was Autistic I struggled a lot.

I struggled to maintain relationships with other people. I still do, but understand why and that makes it easier now.

I struggled with the sensory environment. Now I avoid my triggers.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet:
Also, if I’m honest, these days I don’t struggle as much as I did before I learned I was Autistic & had no accommodations in place to help me with work, school, or life. 

I struggled a lot more before learning I was Autistic.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet:
I sometimes see critique of Autistic People online, who don’t share enough about their struggles.

First, nobody owes you their struggles in pain to read like some kind of soap opera.

Second a lot of people only show the highlights of their life on social media.

description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet: #ActuallyAutistic #AskingAutistics - do you agree?

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet:
5. Being Autistic in the modern world IS a disability. Nobody is claiming it isn’t. However, blaming Autistic People for not fitting into NT society is cruel. It’s time to fix the systems & accommodate Autistic People. 

Autistic People are not broken. The world is broken.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet:
4. People don’t expect NeuroTypical‘s to share all of their weaknesses online. Most people only share the good parts of their life on social media.

Why do you expect Autistic People to owe you all of the personal information that nonAutistics would likely not share either?

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet:
2. Some of us genuinely love being Autistic, despite the hard parts, and want to share that with the world.

3. We need (& still lack) epresentation and role models for our NeuroDivergent young people. Being open/guiding future generations.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet:
1. Historically, most of the conversation about Autistic People has only been about our weaknesses and completely ignored our strengths. 

Some of us are seeking balance to the narrative.

We are more than our weaknesses. We are a combination of our strengths & weaknesses.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet:
Being Autistic is not all sunshine and rainbows. In fact, it sucks sometimes, especially because of society systems & the world being stacked against us.

Let’s talk about why some of us share the good parts of being Autistic:

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet: Recently a group of parents has made a claim that Autistic Adults sharing the better parts of the Autistic Experience online has made it more difficult for parents to peruse services for their children because people don’t automatically see Autism as a bad thing anymore.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet:
Poor and multiply marginalized Autistic People (a large percentage of Autistics) face more barriers to diagnosis.

Just another reason that, despite having a formal diagnosis, I support self identified Autistic People. 

#ActuallyAutistic

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet: In my experience, change (good or bad) is often a trigger for my burnout or mental health spiraling - which is often connected like a chicken and egg problem- does the burnout come first or is it the anxiety?

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet:
For a lot of us late discovered Autistic People, this breakdown (when we reach crisis point) is when we are diagnosed.

These events will often have a trigger, such as a loss of support and accommodation, or new and increased demands in life.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet:
Autistic Masking is when Autistic People either consciously, or subconsciously mask or hide their Autistic traits.

Many of us are chronically exhausted just from surviving in life, and periodically push ourselves too far (until we break down).

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet:
First, what is Autistic Burnout? 

A mental, physical, and emotional state that many Autistic People battle with, because of expectations to keep pace in the NeuroTypical world. 

In children it is sometimes called regression.

Some of us burn out because of constant masking.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet:
I discovered I was autistic at the age of 29 because I had been struggling with Autistic Burnout. 

This is actually something I’ve struggled often on with through my life since I was a child in school.

tweet:
We don’t bark orders at our dogs. 

I encourage them to communicate their needs to me.

We give them choices and ask them questions and wait for answers and permission to do things like pick them up - or let them in or out.

name: NeuroDivergent Rebel (they/them/Xe/Xem) 🧠 🏳️‍🌈
description: (They/Them/Xe/Xem) I’m Lyric, #Queer #NeuroDivergent writer, speaker, educator, & artist. #ActuallyAutistic #ADHD #NeuroDiversity #GenderFluid #AskingAutistics
tweet:
I now teach animals how to communicate with us and do the work to understand how they are communicating in ways that we might miss if we’re not paying attention.

Words are not the only thing you can use to communicate. With animals the way their body moves tells you everything.
